name: CUET (Common University Entrance Test)
description: A national-level entrance examination for admission to various undergraduate, integrated, postgraduate, diploma, and certification courses in Central, State, Deemed, and Private universities across India.

eligibility.ageLimit: No age limit for candidates. However, candidates will need to fulfill the age criteria (if any) of the individual university/institution they are applying to.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Candidates must have passed the Class 12 / equivalent examination or be appearing in the current academic year. Subject and percentage requirements vary according to the specific course and university.
eligibility.nationality: Citizen of India. OCI/PIO/Foreign nationals are also eligible, subject to the rules of the applied university.

examPattern.mode: Hybrid Mode (Offline Pen-and-Paper & Online Computer-Based Test)

stages.name: Stage 1: CUET Written Exam
stages.description: A single-stage entrance exam divided into three sections: Section 1 (Languages), Section 2 (Domain-specific subjects), and Section 3 (General Test). Candidates choose subjects based on the requirements of their desired course and university.

stages.name: Stage 2: University Counselling
stages.description: After the results are declared, participating universities release their own merit lists and conduct counselling/admission processes based on CUET scores and their specific eligibility criteria.

examPattern.markingScheme: +5 marks for each correct answer. -1 mark is deducted for each incorrect answer. 0 marks for unattempted questions.

syllabus.name: Section I (IA & IB): Languages
topics: Reading Comprehension (based on different types of passagesâ€“Factual, Literary and Narrative)

syllabus.name: Section II: Domain-Specific Subjects
topics: The syllabus is based on the Class 12 NCERT curriculum for the respective subject chosen by the candidate. Candidates can choose from a list of 27 domain-specific subjects.

syllabus.name: Section III: General Test
topics: Quantitative Reasoning (application of basic mathematical concepts)

latestUpdate.title: CUET UG 2024 Result to be Declared by June 30

books.title: NCERT Textbooks for Class 12 (for Domain Subjects)
books.author: NCERT

books.title: NTA CUET (UG) Guide for Section III General Test
books.author: Arihant Experts
